metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1652 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Linux Kernel could allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary code on thesystem, caused by a concurrency use-after-free flaw in the bad_flp_intrfunction. By executing a specially-crafted program, an attacker couldexploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial ofservice condition on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1652` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-229-generic - 4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-229-generic - 4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-229-lowlatency - 4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1109-aws - 4.4.0-1109.115
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1149-azure - 4.15.0-1149.164~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1109.115').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1149.164~14.04.1').
